Children.Text:
Good Morning /Afternoon /Evening, My name is __________ and I work as an Enumerator/Supervisor with the Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES), currently undertaken by the Solomon Islands National Statistics Office, on behalf of the Government.

The reason why I am visiting your household is to inform you that your household has been selected to participate in this survey. I am therefore visiting you to conduct a face-to-face interview to ask your household a number of questions that ultimately will assist the government make better decisions and formulate policies that includes real information about households across the country.

I will be asking a number of questions to collect information mainly about household income, expenditure and other related information such as personal characteristics, education, employment, and health amongst others. Although your participation in this survey is voluntary, you are also reminded that this survey is conducted by law (under the Statistics Act 1970 (Amended 2007)). This means that information collected will be kept confidential and will only be used for statistical purposes. The Statistics Act also requires that you cooperate in this survey and provide information when asked.

This survey will take, on average, about 1 hour (60 minutes) to 3 hours (180 minutes). If you agree, we may either conduct the interview strictly with limited time breaks, and/or with small time breaks, or we can agree to take longer breaks during interviews and continue at a later time (or day) that is convenient to your household (but should be within the interview period).

If you consent with the statement I just made, we can proceed with the survey.
